buildingblocks.details: Going being just direct, or indirect support and providing paid support tiers for developers to use, allowing them to pay by the minute, hour, or project, and get the intimate, direct support they desire.

buildingblocks.name: Videos
buildingblocks.summary: Provides video resources, helping people understand the API platform, how it can be put to use, and any other supporting areas of API operations.
buildingblocks.details: Provides video resources, helping people understand the API platform, how it can be put to use, and any other supporting areas of API operations.

buildingblocks.name: Integrations
buildingblocks.summary: Integrations showcase other 3rd party platforms that an API provider is already connected to, providing ready to go platform integration solutions that any developer can take advantage of. This is right between reciprocity tools like Zapier, and not quite platform development kits (PDK).
buildingblocks.details: Integrations showcase other 3rd party platforms that an API provider is already connected to, providing ready to go platform integration solutions that any developer can take advantage of. This is right between reciprocity tools like Zapier, and not quite platform development kits (PDK).

buildingblocks.name: Simulator
buildingblocks.summary: Providing an environemtn where develoeprs can find existing profiles, templates or other collections of data, as well as sequence for simulating a particular experience via an API platform. While this is emerging as critical building block for Internet of Thing APIs, it is something other API providers have been doing to help onboard new users.
buildingblocks.details: Providing an environemtn where develoeprs can find existing profiles, templates or other collections of data, as well as sequence for simulating a particular experience via an API platform. While this is emerging as critical building block for Internet of Thing APIs, it is something other API providers have been doing to help onboard new users.

buildingblocks.name: Status RSS
buildingblocks.summary: Providing an RSS feed for a status dashboard, allowing users to receive updates on any website, and via any RSS client.
buildingblocks.details: Providing an RSS feed for a status dashboard, allowing users to receive updates on any website, and via any RSS client.

buildingblocks.name: Community Supported Libraries
buildingblocks.summary: In addition to providing your own company developed libraries, showcasing the libraries of trusted developers fro within the API community.
buildingblocks.details: In addition to providing your own company developed libraries, showcasing the libraries of trusted developers fro within the API community.

buildingblocks.name: SalesForce
buildingblocks.summary: Providing ready to go SalesForce integration, allowing developers, and sometimes even non-developers to immediately put an API to use through their SalesForce account.
buildingblocks.details: Providing ready to go SalesForce integration, allowing developers, and sometimes even non-developers to immediately put an API to use through their SalesForce account.

buildingblocks.name: Security Overview
buildingblocks.summary: An overview page for your security efforts.
buildingblocks.details: An overview page for your security efforts.

buildingblocks.name: SSL
buildingblocks.summary: Providing SSL for API endpoints, and developer account.
buildingblocks.details: Providing SSL for API endpoints, and developer account.

buildingblocks.name: oAuth
buildingblocks.summary: Using oAuth to secure an API, providing identity and access management.
buildingblocks.details: Using oAuth to secure an API, providing identity and access management.

buildingblocks.name: oAuth
buildingblocks.summary: Providng an oAuth layer to API operations, securing high value APIs, while also opening up a conversation between an API platform, developers, and end-users regarding the access of their content, and valuable data.
buildingblocks.details: Providng an oAuth layer to API operations, securing high value APIs, while also opening up a conversation between an API platform, developers, and end-users regarding the access of their content, and valuable data.

buildingblocks.name: Basic Auth
buildingblocks.summary: Usage of the basic authentication format that is part of the standard HTTP operations, employing a users username and password as credentials for accessing API resources.
buildingblocks.details: Usage of the basic authentication format that is part of the standard HTTP operations, employing a users username and password as credentials for accessing API resources.

buildingblocks.name: Python SDK
buildingblocks.summary: Software Development Kits (SDK) in Python for developers to use when integrating with their applications in the language they are familiar with. SDKs should be expected to be used in production environments.
buildingblocks.details: Software Development Kits (SDK) in Python for developers to use when integrating with their applications in the language they are familiar with. SDKs should be expected to be used in production environments.

buildingblocks.name: Node.js SDK
buildingblocks.summary: Software Development Kits (SDK) in Node.js for developers to use when integrating with their applications in the language they are familiar with. SDKs should be expected to be used in production environments.
buildingblocks.details: Software Development Kits (SDK) in Node.js for developers to use when integrating with their applications in the language they are familiar with. SDKs should be expected to be used in production environments.

buildingblocks.name: Joomla
buildingblocks.summary: Providing ready to go Joomla integration, allowing developers, and sometimes even non-developers to immediately put an API to use through their Joomla account.
buildingblocks.details: Providing ready to go Joomla integration, allowing developers, and sometimes even non-developers to immediately put an API to use through their Joomla account.

buildingblocks.name: API
buildingblocks.summary: Providing an API for the developer account area, providing access to all available features in the API dev account.
buildingblocks.details: Providing an API for the developer account area, providing access to all available features in the API dev account.

buildingblocks.name: Github Authentication
buildingblocks.summary: Allowing developers to create their API account using their Github account, and allowing the to login in the future using their Github oAuth.
buildingblocks.details: Allowing developers to create their API account using their Github account, and allowing the to login in the future using their Github oAuth.

buildingblocks.name: JavaScript Library
buildingblocks.summary: Code libraries in JavaScript for developers to use in their native language. Libraries are simple libraries meant to introduce developers to any API and are usually not meant for production environments.
buildingblocks.details: Code libraries in JavaScript for developers to use in their native language. Libraries are simple libraries meant to introduce developers to any API and are usually not meant for production environments.

buildingblocks.name: Service Tier Management
buildingblocks.summary: The ability to manage your account service tier within a password protected portal, giving developers the ability to change their pricing, and service tier.
buildingblocks.details: The ability to manage your account service tier within a password protected portal, giving developers the ability to change their pricing, and service tier.

buildingblocks.name: Delete Account
buildingblocks.summary: Developers have the ability to delete their account from within their account portal.
buildingblocks.details: Developers have the ability to delete their account from within their account portal.

buildingblocks.name: Google Authentication
buildingblocks.summary: Allowing developers to create their API account using their Google account, and allowing the to login in the future using their Google oAuth.
buildingblocks.details: Allowing developers to create their API account using their Google account, and allowing the to login in the future using their Google oAuth.

buildingblocks.name: Message Center
buildingblocks.summary: Providing developers with a messaging system within their developer accounts, and communicate with API providders, and receive system updates.
buildingblocks.details: Providing developers with a messaging system within their developer accounts, and communicate with API providders, and receive system updates.

buildingblocks.name: Sign Up Email
buildingblocks.summary: Providing a simple, informative, personal email immediately upon signup, letting developers know what they need to onboard.
buildingblocks.details: Providing a simple, informative, personal email immediately upon signup, letting developers know what they need to onboard.

buildingblocks.name: Knowledgebase
buildingblocks.summary: Providing a single repository of content, organized by title, and tag, allowing you to search for keywords and phrases, as well as browse for what you need. All knowledge about an API is curated within the knowledgebse, and updated over time.
buildingblocks.details: Providing a single repository of content, organized by title, and tag, allowing you to search for keywords and phrases, as well as browse for what you need. All knowledge about an API is curated within the knowledgebse, and updated over time.

buildingblocks.name: Code Builder
buildingblocks.summary: A tool allowing for the generation of client code for various API endpoint.
buildingblocks.details: A tool allowing for the generation of client code for various API endpoint.

buildingblocks.name: Monetization Guidelines
buildingblocks.summary: Providing legal gudelines for how developers can monetize around resources that are available via an API.
buildingblocks.details: Providing legal gudelines for how developers can monetize around resources that are available via an API.

buildingblocks.name: Certification Program
buildingblocks.summary: Allowing developer to get certifified, providing a verified layer of developers that can be used by the platform, and ecosystem partners.
buildingblocks.details: Allowing developer to get certifified, providing a verified layer of developers that can be used by the platform, and ecosystem partners.

buildingblocks.name: Internationalization
buildingblocks.summary: Provide resources that help developers localize, and internationalize their applications to meed the needs of specific global markets.
buildingblocks.details: Provide resources that help developers localize, and internationalize their applications to meed the needs of specific global markets.

buildingblocks.name: JavaScript API
buildingblocks.summary: A complete JavaScript API that developers can use to build and manage their own JavaScript integrations with an APIs resources.
buildingblocks.details: A complete JavaScript API that developers can use to build and manage their own JavaScript integrations with an APIs resources.

buildingblocks.name: Zapier
buildingblocks.summary: Provides default Zapier integration, and usually is showcasing it within an API or developer area.
buildingblocks.details: Provides default Zapier integration, and usually is showcasing it within an API or developer area.

buildingblocks.name: Rate Limit Information Inline In Docs
buildingblocks.category: Rate Limit Information Inline In Docs

buildingblocks.name: Account Rate Limit API
buildingblocks.summary: As API usage grows the need to be able to programmaticaly manage your account is increasing. Some API platforms also provide APIs for the management of platform operations. It makes sense that API providers should also offer an API for getting rate limit details for their account.
buildingblocks.details: As API usage grows the need to be able to programmaticaly manage your account is increasing. Some API platforms also provide APIs for the management of platform operations. It makes sense that API providers should also offer an API for getting rate limit details for their account.
